meanings.definition: The act of convicting someone again for a crime.
meanings.sent1: The reconviction of the criminal shocked the community.
meanings.sent2: After his reconviction, he faced a longer sentence.
meanings.sent3: The reconviction of the thief made for an unexpected turn of events.
meanings.sent4: Her reconviction served as a stern warning to other offenders.
meanings.sent5: The reconviction process was thorough and fair.

meanings.definition: The state of being convicted again for a crime.
meanings.sent1: The reconviction of the suspect was a blow to his reputation.
meanings.sent2: She felt immense shame after her reconviction.
meanings.sent3: The reconviction left him feeling regretful and sorrowful.
meanings.sent4: His reconviction weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The reconviction brought back memories of his past mistakes.
